New Records: CJ McCollum highlighted a career high-tying 50 points with 10 3-pointers.
Key Match Events: CJ McCollum scored 50 points, including 10 3-pointers, to help the Pelicans win.
Jordan Poole scored 24 points for the Wizards but was affected by a hard fall under the basket with 4:38 left in the third quarter.
The Pelicans tied a season high with 18 made 3s, going 18 of 41.
Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans was playing at home for the first time since a deadly New Year’s Day attack in the French Quarter, and a moment of silence was held before tipoff.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pelicans snapped an 11-game losing streak with a 132-120 victory over the Washington Wizards.
New Orleans benefitted from the return from injury of reserve guard Jose Alvarado, who contributed 5 points, 3 assists and 3 steals in 20 minutes after missing 23 games.
The Wizards scored a season-high 72 points in the paint, only to have it virtually negated by shaky outside shooting and porous defense that allowed New Orleans a season high in points.
